verses.verse: Elihu <WH453> also proceeded, <WH3254> and said, <WH559>
Suffer <WH3803> me a little, <WH2191> and I will show <WH2331> thee that <WH3588> I have yet <WH5750> to speak <WH4405> on God's <WH433> behalf.
I will fetch <WH5375> my knowledge <WH1843> from afar, <WH4480> <WH7350> and will ascribe <WH5414> righteousness <WH6664> to my Maker. <WH6466>
For <WH3588> truly <WH551> my words <WH4405> shall not <WH3808> be false: <WH8267> he that is perfect <WH8549> in knowledge <WH1844> is with <WH5973> thee.
Behold, <WH2005> God <WH410> is mighty, <WH3524> and despiseth <WH3988> not <WH3808> any: he is mighty <WH3524> in strength <WH3581> and wisdom. <WH3820>
He preserveth not the life <WH2421> <WH3808> of the wicked: <WH7563> but giveth <WH5414> right <WH4941> to the poor. <WH6041>

He withdraweth <WH1639> not <WH3808> his eyes <WH5869> from the righteous: <WH4480> <WH6662> but with <WH854> kings <WH4428> are they on the throne; <WH3678> yea, he doth establish <WH3427> them forever, <WH5331> and they are exalted. <WH1361>
And if <WH518> they be bound <WH631> in fetters, <WH2131> and be holden <WH3920> in cords <WH2256> of affliction; <WH6040>
Then he showeth <WH5046> them their work, <WH6467> and their transgressions <WH6588> that <WH3588> they have exceeded. <WH1396>
He openeth <WH1540> also their ear <WH241> to discipline, <WH4148> and commandeth <WH559> that <WH3588> they return <WH7725> from iniquity. <WH4480> <WH205>
If <WH518> they obey <WH8085> and serve <WH5647> him, they shall spend <WH3615> their days <WH3117> in prosperity, <WH2896> and their years <WH8141> in pleasures. <WH5273>
But if <WH518> they obey <WH8085> not, <WH3808> they shall perish <WH5674> by the sword, <WH7973> and they shall die <WH1478> without <WH1097> knowledge. <WH1847>
But the hypocrites <WH2611> in heart <WH3820> heap up <WH7760> wrath: <WH639> they cry <WH7768> not <WH3808> when <WH3588> he bindeth <WH631> them.
They <WH5315> die <WH4191> in youth, <WH5290> and their life <WH2416> is among the unclean. <WH6945>
He delivereth <WH2502> the poor <WH6041> in his affliction, <WH6040> and openeth <WH1540> their ears <WH241> in oppression. <WH3906>

Even so <WH637> would he have removed <WH5496> thee out of the strait <WH4480> <WH6310> <WH6862> into a broad place, <WH7338> where <WH8478> there is no <WH3808> straitness; <WH4164> and that which should be set <WH5183> on thy table <WH7979> should be full <WH4390> of fatness. <WH1880>
But thou hast fulfilled <WH4390> the judgment <WH1779> of the wicked: <WH7563> judgment <WH1779> and justice <WH4941> take hold <WH8551> on thee.
Because <WH3588> there is wrath, <WH2534> beware lest <WH6435> he take thee away <WH5496> with his stroke: <WH5607> then a great <WH7227> ransom <WH3724> cannot <WH408> deliver <WH5186> thee.
Will he esteem <WH6186> thy riches? <WH7769> no, not <WH3808> gold, <WH1222> nor all <WH3605> the forces <WH3981> of strength. <WH3581>
Desire <WH7602> not <WH408> the night, <WH3915> when people <WH5971> are cut off <WH5927> in their place. <WH8478>
Take heed, <WH8104> regard not <WH6437> <WH408> <WH413> iniquity: <WH205> for <WH3588> <WH5921> this <WH2088> hast thou chosen <WH977> rather than affliction. <WH4480> <WH6040>
Behold, <WH2005> God <WH410> exalteth <WH7682> by his power: <WH3581> who <WH4310> teacheth <WH3384> like him? <WH3644>
Who <WH4310> hath enjoined <WH6485> <WH5921> him his way? <WH1870> or who <WH4310> can say, <WH559> Thou hast wrought <WH6466> iniquity? <WH5766>
Remember <WH2142> that <WH3588> thou magnify <WH7679> his work, <WH6467> which <WH834> men <WH376> behold. <WH7789>
Every <WH3605> man <WH120> may see <WH2372> it; man <WH582> may behold <WH5027> it afar off. <WH4480> <WH7350>
Behold, <WH2005> God <WH410> is great, <WH7689> and we know <WH3045> him not <WH3808> neither <WH3808> can the number <WH4557> of his years <WH8141> be searched out. <WH2714>
For <WH3588> he maketh small <WH1639> the drops <WH5198> of water: <WH4325> they pour down <WH2212> rain <WH4306> according to the vapor <WH108> thereof:
Which <WH834> the clouds <WH7834> do drop <WH5140> and distill <WH7491> upon <WH5921> man <WH120> abundantly. <WH7227>
Also <WH637> <WH518> can any understand <WH995> the spreadings <WH4666> of the clouds, <WH5645> or the noise <WH8663> of his tabernacle? <WH5521>
Behold, <WH2005> he spreadeth <WH6566> his light <WH216> upon <WH5921> it, and covereth <WH3680> the bottom <WH8328> of the sea. <WH3220>
For <WH3588> by them judgeth <WH1777> he the people; <WH5971> he giveth <WH5414> meat <WH400> in abundance. <WH4342>
With <WH5921> clouds <WH3709> he covereth <WH3680> the light; <WH216> and commandeth <WH6680> it not to shine by <WH5921> the cloud that cometh between. <WH6293>
The noise <WH7452> thereof showeth <WH5046> concerning <WH5921> it, the cattle <WH4735> also <WH637> concerning <WH5921> the vapor. <WH5927>
